alignments.submission_title: DiCAMS: Dynamic Intelligent Context-Aware Memory System
alignments.submission_overview:
DiCAMS (Dynamic Intelligent Context-Aware Memory System) is a patent-pending cognitive infrastructure designed to give AI true continuity over time — across both structured and unstructured data. Most AI systems today — even those using RAG or agent-based architectures — lack persistent, intelligent memory. They retrieve information but don’t maintain continuity. DiCAMS solves this by generating a dynamic memory graph that grows and adapts with user input, real-world data, and contextual signals. Think of it as a scaffolded memory system that doesn’t just store — it organizes, summarizes, and forgets intelligently.

Where this matters most:
- Healthcare: longitudinal patient data contextualization
- Enterprise AI: evolving knowledge workflows
- Agent ecosystems: shared context and alignment

DiCAMS acts like a smart librarian — not only filing information but writing the index, linking the chapters, and updating the story as it unfolds. It’s not just a better retrieval system. It’s a meta-layer for cognition — the missing infrastructure for truly intelligent, user-aligned AI.

This submission was generated with protocol META-DP-EVAL-v1.3

alignments.summary: Data packets and their lineage are verifiable and auditable, ensuring that outputs from intelligent agents can be bounded by trust domains.
alignments.submission_title: Towards Decentralized Applications: Rethinking Control Power and Data Exchange in Named-Data Networking
alignments.submission_overview: This submission presents a comprehensive framework and prototype for decentralized applications built on Named-Data Networking (NDN), aimed at resolving centralization in control power over user data, identity, and communications. Through the design, implementation, and evaluation of "NDN Workspace," the work demonstrates how semantic naming, data-centric security, and distributed data synchronization can enable direct, secure, and serverless peer-to-peer collaboration. The study also contributes critical insights into naming schemes, trust schema enforcement, and the broader ecosystem architecture required to support real-time collaborative applications outside the cloud paradigm. This submission was generated with protocol META-DP-EVAL-v1.3.

alignments.summary: Maintains AI models exclusively on user devices, reducing external manipulation risks.
alignments.submission_title: AI as the Ultimate Safety Layer
alignments.submission_overview: Digital crimes—scams, phishing, deepfakes, and sophisticated social-engineered fraud—are rapidly escalating in complexity and frequency. Rather than viewing AI as merely exacerbating these threats, this submission proposes an OS-level 'Safety Agent,' a localized AI capable of proactively detecting digital threats, providing mental health interventions, improving personal judgment, and enabling enterprise compliance without compromising privacy. By operating solely on-device and integrated at the operating system level, this solution maximizes data security and user trust. This submission was generated with protocol META-DP-EVAL-v1.3 Based on article by Scott Belsky: https://www.implications.com/p/the-emergence-of-safety-layers-religion

clarifications.submission_title: Vicariance as a Desirable Meta-Layer Property
clarifications.submission_overview: Vicariance, drawn from biological systems, describes how temporary divisions in ecosystems allow novel or fragile designs to incubate before facing widespread exposure or competition. This submission proposes Vicariance as a desirable meta-layer property — one that would enable safe experimentation and staged integration of innovations, ideas, and social formations within decentralized digital networks. It suggests resisting immediate global unification to maintain diverse paths of emergence. This submission was generated with protocol META-DP-EVAL-v1.3.
clarifications.clarification: Suggests vicariance as a structural containment mechanism — not by suppression, but by designing segments of the network where AI influence can be regulated and scaled carefully.
